intros.positano: Tất cả về Positano: đường đến, hoạt động và cách tận hưởng tối đa dù ở hostel hay phòng riêng.
intros.transport: Bản dịch đang được chuẩn bị.
intros.ferry: Phà là cách di chuyển ngắm cảnh giữa các thị trấn trong mùa. Dùng cẩm nang để biết phà chạy khi nào, cách đọc lịch hãng và xử lý khi biển động. Chúng tôi liên kết nguồn chính thống, gợi ý giờ lên phà thông minh và cách kết hợp một chặng phà với xe buýt để cân bằng thoải mái và chi phí.
intros.bus: Xe buýt SITA là trụ cột của chuyến đi không cần ô tô quanh Amalfi Coast. Thẻ này gồm thông tin vé, cách xác nhận, ứng xử giờ cao điểm và các điểm dừng giúp giảm leo bậc ở Positano. Chúng tôi cũng hướng dẫn cách kết hợp xe buýt với phà để hành trình nhanh hoặc đẹp hơn mà không tốn kém.
intros.budgeting: Bạn hoàn toàn có thể khám phá Amalfi Coast với ngân sách hợp lý. Bắt đầu bằng bảng chi phí và danh sách tiết kiệm, sau đó chọn lịch trình ưu tiên viewpoint miễn phí, bãi biển công cộng và sử dụng thẻ vé thông minh. Chúng tôi cũng chỉ ra chỗ nên chi để tận hưởng tối đa — và nơi có thể tiết kiệm mà vẫn trọn vẹn.
intros.free: Miễn phí hay giá rẻ không hề nhàm chán. Thẻ này tập hợp viewpoint yêu thích, bãi biển công cộng, lối dạo bộ và trải nghiệm DIY để bạn ghép thành ngày đáng nhớ mà vẫn tiết kiệm.
intros.itinerary: Lịch trình gọn gàng theo ngày, hạn chế đi vòng và phù hợp thời tiết cũng như ánh sáng.
intros.amalfi: Thị trấn Amalfi là nút phà chính và nối Ravello bằng xe buýt nhanh chóng. Dựa vào cẩm nang để lên kế hoạch đi trong ngày, hiểu hậu cần bến tàu và quyết định khi nào nên chọn phà thay vì xe buýt để vừa thoải mái vừa ngắm cảnh.
intros.ravello: Ravello nổi tiếng với vườn và hoà nhạc. Dùng xe buýt từ Amalfi, lên kế hoạch về muộn và thưởng thức hoàng hôn trên cao.
intros.capri: Capri dành phần thưởng cho người đến sớm: đi phà đầu tiên, vòng Anacapri và Marina Piccola rồi quay lại trước giờ phà cuối. Cẩm nang giúp bạn chọn phương án tiết kiệm và tuyến tránh đám đông.
intros.photography: Tổng hợp góc chụp, ánh sáng và ứng xử để chụp đẹp mà không cản đường ai.
intros.viewpoints: Những viewpoint đẹp nhất để ngắm biển và làng chồng tầng — kèm chỉ dẫn cách đến.
intros.hiking: Những đường mòn như Con Đường của Các Vị Thần mang lại tầm nhìn tuyệt đẹp. Học cách đến bằng xe buýt, các lựa chọn lộ trình ngắn hoặc ít hại đầu gối và chuẩn bị cho nắng gắt hay thời tiết đổi nhanh.
intros.stairs: Minh hoạ tuyến ít bậc và mẹo dùng xe buýt để giảm leo dốc.
intros.porters: Khuân vác là cứu cánh khi mang vali nặng. Chúng tôi chỉ ra khi nào nên thuê, nơi gặp và mức giá hợp lý.
intros.connectivity: Wi‑Fi, eSIM và ổ cắm: thông tin thực tế cho người làm việc từ xa. Chúng tôi cung cấp tốc độ điển hình, phương án dự phòng và ứng xử khi làm việc trong quán cà phê.
intros.digital-nomads: Cân bằng công việc và du lịch tại Positano hoàn toàn khả thi khi chuẩn bị kỹ. Bạn sẽ tìm thấy mẹo về thói quen, góc yên tĩnh và mùa vụ để vừa hoàn thành deadline vừa kịp ngắm hoàng hôn.
intros.cuisine: Từ limoncello đến pasta hải sản và món tráng miệng vị chanh, hãy biết nên thử gì và cách gọi tự tin. Chúng tôi ưu tiên trải nghiệm nhỏ, chân thật và cách nếm đa dạng mà không overspend.
intros.event: Những lễ hội và buổi hoà nhạc theo mùa làm bờ biển thêm rực rỡ. Cẩm nang tập trung vào cách tham dự trơn tru: vé, trang phục, đường đi và vị trí xem đẹp.
intros.seasonal: Mùa cao điểm, giao mùa hay mùa đông đều có đặc trưng riêng. Chúng tôi giúp bạn điều chỉnh kế hoạch theo lịch phà, thời tiết và giờ mở cửa.
intros.no-car: Không cần ô tô vẫn khám phá trọn vẹn. Chúng tôi chỉ cách ghép phà và xe buýt để tới các điểm nổi bật mà không mệt.
intros.passes: Thẻ xe buýt/phà nào đáng mua? Chúng tôi so sánh giá, phạm vi và cách kích hoạt.
intros.decision: Những ngã rẽ như chọn bay vào Naples hay Salerno có thể thay đổi cả ngày. Cẩm nang quyết định nêu rõ ưu/nhược theo mùa, thời gian, hành lý và chi phí để bạn chọn nhanh.
intros.train: Nắm rõ tuyến tàu đến Sorrento hay Salerno trước khi tiếp tục bằng xe buýt/phà.
intros.off-season: Mùa thấp điểm yên tĩnh nhưng dịch vụ hạn chế. Biết cái gì còn mở, thời tiết ra sao và nên chuẩn bị đồ dùng gì.
intros.winter: Mùa đông Positano yên tĩnh, dịch vụ ít hơn. Tìm hiểu những gì còn mở và cách tận hưởng không khí lễ hội.
intros.camping: Cắm trại gần Amalfi Coast cần chuẩn bị kỹ. Chúng tôi chỉ các khu được phép, điều kiện tiếp cận và quy tắc ứng xử, an toàn để có trải nghiệm dễ chịu.
intros.cost: Hiểu biên độ chi tiêu phổ biến và những yếu tố khiến ngân sách tăng giảm. Chúng tôi gợi ý các điều chỉnh nhỏ giúp trải nghiệm phong phú mà vẫn kiểm soát chi phí.
intros.tips: Những mẹo đúc rút từ trải nghiệm thực tế: đóng gói nhẹ, đổi kế hoạch khi thời tiết xấu và tận dụng khung giờ yên tĩnh.
intros.work-life: Sắp xếp lịch làm việc đan xen khám phá. Chúng tôi gợi ý góc làm việc yên tĩnh, Wi‑Fi ổn định và khoảng thời gian thư giãn.
intros.souvenirs: Quà lưu niệm chân thật không cần đắt đỏ. Tìm địa chỉ uy tín và mẹo đóng gói đồ dễ vỡ mang về.
intros.comparison: Đang phân vân nơi làm căn cứ? So sánh tầm nhìn của Positano, kết nối của Sorrento và sự cân bằng tại Amalfi để chọn đúng với phong cách và ngân sách.
intros.insurance: Tóm tắt nhanh về quyền lợi bảo hiểm cho sức khỏe, huỷ chuyến, thiết bị, leo núi và đi phà. Giữ giấy tờ quan trọng trong tầm tay.
intros.hitchhiking: Đường hẹp và hiếm điểm dừng an toàn. Đi nhờ xe không được khuyến khích; chúng tôi đưa ra lựa chọn thay thế an toàn mà vẫn tiết kiệm.
intros.walking-tour: Các lối bậc thang và sân thượng tạo nên tour đi bộ DIY hoàn hảo. Chúng tôi có lộ trình cân bằng cảnh đẹp với sức lực.
intros.audio-guide: Tải audio trước khi đi hoặc dùng điểm Wi‑Fi dọc đường. Giữ âm lượng nhỏ và lưu ý người đi bộ khác trên các lối đông.
intros.work-exchange: Muốn trao đổi công việc tại hostel? Hiểu rõ vai trò, giờ làm và pháp lý ở Ý trước khi nhận lời — cùng mẹo đánh giá cơ hội uy tín.
intros.wellness: Giữ cơ thể khoẻ mạnh với đường bậc thang, chạy biển và thời gian tập luyện mát mẻ. Đừng quên nước và giày tốt.
intros.couples: Các cặp đôi vẫn tận hưởng hostel nếu chuẩn bị đúng. Chọn phòng riêng hoặc giường chiến lược, mang bịt tai và lên lịch hoạt động sớm để phố phường bớt đông.
intros.accommodation: Chọn nơi lưu trú phù hợp phong cách và ngân sách. Chúng tôi giải thích từng khu vực, đánh đổi và cách giảm số bậc khi đến lẫn rời đi.
intros.hostel-life: Hostel vừa sôi động vừa tiết kiệm. Tìm hiểu Brikette có gì — từ sân thượng, quầy bar đến mẹo sử dụng không gian chung thoải mái.
intros.logistics: Những chi tiết nhỏ tạo nên chuyến đi suôn sẻ: vé, điểm dừng, mang hành lý và các đường tắt ít bậc.
intros.travel-tips: Tổng hợp mẹo nhỏ giúp chuyến đi mượt mà: từ đặt vé trước đến cách tránh xếp hàng dài.
intros.experiences: Tour thuyền, ngày biển, đường mòn và viewpoint — các bài viết giúp bạn chọn trải nghiệm phù hợp với thời gian, ngân sách và sức lực.
intros.boat: Tour thuyền riêng hoặc ghép là điểm nhấn khi biển êm. Chúng tôi nêu kỳ vọng, mùa hoạt động và lựa chọn thay thế khi biển động.
intros.rome: Di chuyển từ Rome khá đơn giản: tàu cao tốc đến Naples/Salerno rồi xe buýt hoặc phà. Chúng tôi giúp bạn chọn phương án phù hợp thời gian và ngân sách.
intros.car: Lái xe dọc bờ biển đẹp nhưng đòi hỏi kinh nghiệm. Tìm hiểu vùng ZTL, thực tế đỗ xe và quy định biển số luân phiên mùa cao điểm trước khi quyết định.
intros.wineries: Nhà rượu gia đình ở Tramonti mang lại trải nghiệm đáng nhớ. Đặt chỗ trước và chuẩn bị phương án di chuyển an toàn.
intros.tramonti: Tramonti nổi tiếng rượu DOC. Đặt lịch sớm, chuẩn bị đường đèo và phân công người lái an toàn.
intros.scooter: Xe tay ga linh hoạt nhưng rủi ro trên tuyến SS163 nhiều khúc cua khuất. Chỉ thuê khi bạn có kinh nghiệm, mang đủ giấy tờ và cân nhắc Sorrento để giá tốt hơn.
intros.pets: Du lịch cùng thú cưng cần thêm kế hoạch. Kiểm tra chính sách phương tiện, nơi thân thiện và cách bảo vệ bàn chân khỏi mặt đường nóng.
intros.shopping: Ủng hộ nghệ nhân địa phương bằng sandals đóng theo chân, gốm và tranh in. Hỏi kỹ chất liệu, nguồn gốc và cách vận chuyển an toàn.
intros.stories: Truyền thuyết về nàng tiên cá tới các vị thánh giúp hiểu thêm lễ hội và mốc địa danh.
intros.history: Một chút lịch sử Positano và Amalfi Coast giúp mỗi bước chân thêm ý nghĩa: tuyến thương mại, tôn giáo và du lịch hiện đại giao thoa ở đây.
intros.language: Vài câu tiếng Ý giúp chuyến đi trơn tru hơn. Học từ vựng cho xe buýt, phà, quán cà phê và cách nói lời cảm ơn lịch sự.
intros.gateway: Sorrento, Salerno và Naples là cửa ngõ vào Amalfi Coast. Tận dụng chúng để đến nơi thông minh hơn và tiết kiệm chi phí kết nối.

meta.title: Age Requirements & Accessibility - Hostel Brikette, Positano Guide
meta.description: Discover age restrictions, accessibility details, self-sufficiency policies, minors guidelines, amenities, transport tips, house rules, and sustainability practices at the only hostel in Positano.

content.accessibilityRequirements: Set into the steep, postcard-perfect cliffs for which Positano is world-famous, Hostel Brikette occupies a lovingly developed nineteenth-century residence that was never designed with modern elevators or ramps. Reaching reception requires climbing approximately 30 outdoor stone steps from the nearest pedestrian lane, and most dormitories are a further one or two internal flights above that level. As a hostel, we do not have a conceirge service, so you will need to plan around carrying your bags youself.
content.arrivalByFerry: The port is some distance from the hostel.  Whilst it can be nice to arrive by ferry, you will need to plan to get to the hostel.  We do not recommend doing so on foot, with any substantial luggage or baggage, particularly in the summer.  We recommend using Positano's registered porter services, who will bring your things direct to the hostel for you. We also recommend using the local bus service. You can get directions, along with many other useful tips, via our app, which you will receive access to when you book.
content.arrivalByBus: The closest bus stop to us is 100m/300ft away.  It is flat between us and the bus stop, so you just need to plan on getting your things from the street to your room.
content.generalArrivalTips: For reasons set out above, we advise packing light, using backpacks rather than wheeled suitcases, and wearing sensible shoes with grip.
content.reducedMobility: If you have reduced mobility, a visual impairment, or rely on assistive devices, please email us in advance so that we can describe the layout in detail and help you assess whether the area and the hostel's building meets your personal requirements.
content.serviceAnimals: Please note that we can only host certified service animals in private rooms only, subject to prior arrangement and national regulations.
content.assistedSleeping: To preserve a restful atmosphere in shared spaces, devices that create continuous or intermittent sound - such as CPAP machines, white-noise generators, meditation speakers, or talking clocks - may be used only when a private room has been booked.
content.selfSufficiencyPolicy: In keeping with the independent spirit of backpacking, we operate on a self-catering, self-service basis. Our small team is always happy to help, but we are not doctors, pharmacists, nurses, or professional caregivers, and cannot legally store or administer prescription medication. All guests must be able to carry their own luggage, climb the stairs described above, check themselves in and out, manage personal hygiene, and interact in social spaces, without staff intervention.
content.essentialMedicine: If you travel with essential medication that requires refrigeration, we can store that for you; please email us before arrival to reserve space. The nearest pharmacy is 450 m away on Viale Pasitea and the closest public medical clinic is in Praiano, 3 km by bus. Should a health emergency occur, staff will immediately contact Italian emergency services (dial 118), but we cannot, ourselves, provide professional medical assistance on site. If during your stay it becomes apparent that you are unable to meet these minimum self-sufficiency standards, management reserves the right to terminate your reservation in accordance with Article 1382 of the Italian Civil Code. Any unused nights will be refunded minus the first night and card processing fees.
content.minorsPolicy: Italian hospitality regulations are particularly clear when it comes to protecting young travellers, which we fully support. Children aged 16 and under may stay only in private rooms, when accompanied by a parent or legal guardian who is at least 18 years old, and who sleeps in the same room for the entire stay. School, sports, or scout groups under 18 must book the entire property or arrange exclusive room occupancy, and must provide a signed declaration of responsibility on official letterhead from the organising institution at least seven days before arrival. For guests who are 17 years old, mixed-gender or single-gender dormitories may be booked, provided that a supervising adult aged 18+ occupies a bed in the same dorm and submits - on arrival - either a notarised parental consent form or documented proof of guardianship. Under no circumstances can minors be left unattended in common areas. Failure to comply with the above rules will result in immediate cancellation without refund, and, where relevant, notification of local authorities as required by Italian public-safety law (Consolidated Text of Public Security, Article 109).
content.locationOverview: We are located within 100m/300ft of the nearest main line bus stop, and the local bus stop. Grocery stores, an ATM/cashpoint, restaurants, and a small electronics store are also located very close to the hostel. We have a very good position for day trips and local conveniences. Positano's tourist center, beaches, and ferry port is located further away. You can get into this area using the local bus.
content.transportationGuide: Reaching Positano and Hostel Brikette from Naples International Airport (Capodichino) you can take the Curreri Viaggi shuttle to Sorrento Circumvesuviana station, then hop on the SITA Sud bus toward Amalfi, disembarking at the “Positano Chiesa Nuova” stop. We provide very detailed guides on getting to the hostel, to help you plan your trip here. We recommend reading them, as it can help save you time and effort on your journey.  Seasonal ferries will drop you off at Positano port, but note that you will want to plan carefully for getting from the port to the hostel. Arriving by car is possible but not recommended: historic-centre parking is extremely limited and costs upward of €45 per day. If you really want to drive, pre-book a space at Garage Mandara and plan to unload luggage at the hostel before going to part.

meta.title: Booking Basics: Your Essential Guide to Staying at Hostel Brikette, Positano - the Only Hostel in Positano
meta.description: Discover everything you need to know before you book the only hostel in Positano, on Italy's Amalfi Coast. Learn about secure payments, flexible and non-refundable bookings, check-in rules, cancellation policies, and insider tips for an unforgettable stay in Positano's only hostel.

content.aboutOurHostel: Skylar SRL proudly operates Hostel Brikette, Positano - the only hostel in Positano. You'll find us at Via Guglielmo Marconi 358, 84017 Positano, Salerno, Italy. We are perfectly located for the Amalfi Coast, being central to Amalfi, Ravello, Sorrento, and the island of Capri - making us perfect not just for Positano but also day trips to each of those places. From our panoramic terrace, you will be surrounded by mountains, and have great views of the famous limestone cliffs as they plunge into the sea below. If you're searching for affordability, social atmosphere, unbeatable views, great service, then check out Hostel Brikette.
content.termsAndConditions: Our terms and conditions are transparent, concise, and designed to protect both you and us. They outline essential details like payment schedules, security deposit rules, quiet-hour policies, and guest-only access to dormitories. The terms and conditions are aligned with Italian tourism legislation and standard hostel practices across Europe. We strongly encourage all guests to familiarise themselves with these terms before arriving so that there are no surprises after check-in. By completing your booking, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and accepted Hostel Brikette's Terms & Conditions,
content.youCustomerGuest: This booking guide aims to help every guest who either stays overnight or interacts with the hostel on someone else's behalf. Whether you are a solo backpacker, a digital nomad, a couple on a romantic getaway, a group leader coordinating a school trip, or simply a temporary visitor dropping by to enjoy the terrace, these guidelines ensure that everyone is treated fairly and the hostel operates smoothly.
content.roomBookingRequest: Booking your stay at Hostel Brikette is quick and secure. You can reserve directly on this website for the best rates, flexible policies, and to gain access to complimentary breakfast and evening drinks. You can also book to stay at the hostel through trusted online travel agencies (OTAs) such as Hostelworld and Booking.com.
content.onlyHostelPositano: Hostel Brikette is Positano's only hostel. Book directly or contact us to ensure you make a valid booking at our hostel. Please also note that unauthorised resale or transfer of bookings is strictly prohibited and will result in immediate cancellation without refund.
content.communalAreas: Our communal areas are designed for social interaction and unrivalled Mediterranean vistas. Enjoy morning cappuccinos on our terrace, join sunset aperitivo hour overlooking Positano's bay area, or catch up on remote work in beautiful lobby equipped with free Wi-Fi. We also provide spacious, gender-segregated communal bathrooms with hot-water available 24/7. Temporary visitors may share these areas during visiting hours, as long as they present valid ID at reception.
content.creditCardHolder: The credit-card holder - the person whose name appears on the card used to secure the booking - is ultimately responsible for all accommodation charges, add-ons, and penalties incurred. If you are booking on behalf of someone else, please ensure you have written permission from the card holder, or contact us so we can arrange a secure third-party payment link.
content.counteroffer: In high-demand periods such as June to September, certain room types may sell out fast. If your preferred dorm bed or private room is unavailable, we'll promptly send you a friendly counter-offer suggesting alternative dates or room categories. Feel free to accept, reject, or negotiate - our team is all based here in the Amalfi Coast and will help you lock in the ideal hostel experience.
content.confirmedRoomBooking: Your reservation is considered confirmed the instant you receive our automated confirmation email. This document details your booking reference, arrival date, number of nights, bed type (mixed dorm, female-only dorm, or private room), and total cost. Keep this email handy - you'll need to show it at check-in if your surname doesn't match the booking name.
content.noShow: A "no-show" occurs when a guest fails to arrive and complete check-in by 22:00 (local time) on the scheduled arrival date. To protect our small, independent business from lost revenue, no-shows are charged the full first night or the entire non-refundable balance, whichever amount is greater. If you anticipate a late arrival, simply email us before 21:00 so we can arrange a late self-check-in kit.
content.roomCancellationRequest: Plans change - we get it! If you must cancel your stay in Positano, please notify us as early as possible by emailing hostelpositano@gmail.com. Early cancellations free up beds for other backpackers exploring the Amalfi Coast and may reduce or eliminate any applicable fees for you.
content.cancellationNoticePeriod: Unless otherwise stated on your rate plan, a standard 72-hour cancellation policy applies. This means you must cancel by 15:00, three full days before your arrival date, to avoid charges. Non-refundable or "early bird" discounted rates may have different terms, so always check your confirmation email for specifics.
content.cancellationAdministrationFee: A small €5 administration fee per booking may apply to cover transaction costs associated with processing refunds and updating inventory across multiple booking platforms. This fee is clearly displayed at the time of reservation and reiterated in your confirmation email.
content.hostelOfficialEmail: For any official correspondence - whether it's a special request, group inquiry, or visa confirmation letter - write to our dedicated inbox at hostelpositano@gmail.com. We answer emails daily from 08:00 to 22:00.
content.bookingChangeRequest: Need to move your booking forward a week, add another traveller, or upgrade to a sea-view private? Send your request by email using the subject line "Booking Change - [Your Surname, Arrival Date]." Changes are subject to availability but we always do our best to keep guests happy and flexibility high.
content.designatedEmailAddress: A valid email address is mandatory at the time of booking because it is how we send confirmation that you have booked to stay with us at Hostel Brikette. If you do not receive an email within ten minutes of booking, please check your spam folder and mark us as a safe sender. We also send access to an application that you can use to plan your travel, time whilst you are at the hostel, place orders for food and drink, and so on. This application is very helpful, and will ensure you get the most of your time at Hostel Brikette, in Positano and along the Amalfi Coast.
content.bookingExtensionRequest: Once you've experienced Positano's cliffside charm, you may decide you never want to leave. No problem - email or speak to reception about extending your stay. Extra nights are granted on a first-come, first-serve basis, so let us know early, especially during the peak Amalfi Coast season.
content.checkInRequest: Check-in runs daily from 15:00 to 22:00. If you reach Positano before room time, we'll store your luggage for free (we can store luggage from 10:30am, daily), so you can head straight to Spiaggia Grande, the Sentiero degli Dei hiking trail, grab a bite to eat, etc. Please have your passport or ID ready for a swift registration.
content.assignedRoom: During check-in we'll assign you a bed or private room best suited to your reservation type and group size. Housekeeping prepares rooms between 10:30 and 15:00, so earlier access cannot always be guaranteed; however, our terrace are available if you'd like to freshen up immediately after arrival.
content.hostelRooms: Choose among accommodation categories: 4-bed, 6-bed, 7-bed, and 8-bed dorms.  Whether you want a mixed bed or female-only room.  We have rooms with and without views.  We have a private double with en-suite. All dorms have secure lockers, reading lights, USB charging ports, WiFi, and air-conditioning.
content.linen: Each guest receives freshly laundered cotton sheets, a comfy pillow, and a bath towel. For ecological reasons, we change linens every fourth night of extended stays. Additional towels are available for a small fee - just ask at reception.
content.roomUpgrade: Occasionally, we surprise lucky guests with a complimentary upgrade, but we do cannot guarantee to do so, nor do we have a rewards scheme or such which promotes an upgrade chance.  Whilst paid upgrade might be possible, during peak summer months, and possibly at other busy times, it might not be possible. We recommend booking the room you want to ensure you get what you are looking for.
content.keycard: We issue RFID keycards at check-in, on 10 euros deposit.  The keycard grants 24-hour access to your specific room. Lost cards incur a €10 replacement fee, so please keep yours safe. Remember to return your keycard at check-out, so that we can refund your deposit.
content.preauthorization: To secure your spot, we may perform a temporary pre-authorisation on your card equal to the cost of the first night. This hold is released automatically by your bank within a few days, depending on their policies. It is not a debit - simply a guarantee that you intend to enjoy your stay at Hostel Brikette.
content.checkout: Check-out time is 10:30am, giving our housekeeping team enough time to prepare rooms for incoming travellers. Before leaving, strip your bed, return your linens and keycard, and pick up any belongings from communal areas or the luggage room. Luggage storage after check-out is free until 15:30pm.
content.minor: Under Italian law, anyone under 18 must present a notarised parental consent form if travelling without a legal guardian. Minors are only permitted in private rooms, and may not share mixed dormitories with unrelated adults.
content.complimentaryService: If you book directly with Hostel Brikette, we can provide complimentary perks to stretch your budget: a quality breakfast and evening drinks.  All guests may receive complimentary Wi-Fi throughout the property, use of a communal fridge to store snacks, and luggage storage before check-in or after check-out. These services are complimentary, and subject to terms and conditions.
content.temporaryGuest: We understand that friends and travel companions staying elsewhere may want to visit you. Temporary guests might be allowed to visit, in the lobby and terrace, between 10:30am and 20:00pm.  We need any temporary visitors to sign-in at reception with valid ID. We may decline to host temporary visitors for any reason, including that we need to ensure the safety and security of guests. Overnight stays without a booking are not permitted.
content.acceptedPaymentMethods: We accept Visa and Mastercard credit or debit cards, as well as cash in euros. Corporations and universities organising group trips can pay via bank transfer by prior arrangement. Unfortunately, we do not accept American Express or cryptocurrency at this time.
content.prepaidNonRefundableBookings: Pre-paid, non-refundable bookings lock in the lowest available price for your chosen dates. The total amount is charged immediately after reservation and cannot be refunded under any circumstances, even in the event of travel disruptions. This rate is ideal for travellers who are 100 % certain of their itinerary and wish to secure a bed in Positano's only hostel during the busy summer months.
content.firstComeFirstToChoose: Dormitory bunks operate on a first-come, first-choose basis, allowing early arrivals the privilege of selecting top or bottom bunks. If you have mobility concerns and require a lower bunk, please note that we cannot guarantee that you will get one.
content.refundableBookings: Flexible, refundable bookings offer peace of mind to travellers with uncertain schedules. Pay only a small deposit today and settle the balance on arrival. Cancellations within the permitted window incur no additional charge, and date changes are usually possible subject to availability.
content.proofOfIdentity: Italian law requires us to register every guest with local authorities. Acceptable forms of ID include passport (recommended), EU national identity card, valid driver's licence, or military ID. Photocopies are not accepted. Failure to produce ID may result in denied check-in without refund.
content.seriousDefect: Your comfort and safety are our top priorities. If you find any defect - from a flickering reading light to a leaky shower - alert reception immediately. We will either fix the issue on the spot or relocate you to another bed or room of equal value.

meta.title: Changing and Cancelling Your Positano Hostel Reservation
meta.description: Detailed guidance on your cancellation options, no-show policies, how to modify your reservation, booking transfer rules, and pre-paid non-refundable bookings at Positano's only hostel.

content.noShowCharges: If you haven't checked in by 22:30 (10:30 PM) on the first day of your reservation, your booking will automatically be marked as a 'No-Show.' You will be charged the higher of either the first night's stay or your non-refundable deposit. If you hold multiple bookings, each one may carry its own cancellation notice period and fees.
content.cancellationsPolicy: Send all cancellation requests in writing to our official email address (hostelpositano@gmail.com). The cancellation period begins when the hostel receives your email and ends at 00:01 on your scheduled check-in date. Your booking remains active until you receive email confirmation that the cancellation has been processed. A separate Cancellation Administration Fee—usually 15% of the booking price excluding third-party commissions—will be charged. The hostel may cancel your booking without a written request if you fail to check in before reception closes on arrival day, depart early without proper notification, or violate hostel policies. If you do not provide sufficient notice, you will incur charges equivalent to a No-Show.
content.changingConfirmedBookings: Existing reservations cannot be directly modified; instead, they are replaced entirely with new bookings. Email your change request to our official email address within the required notice period. You will receive an email once the change is approved. All changes are subject to room availability and other conditions. If you shorten or extend your stay, the adjustment will be handled as a cancellation or extension request, and any extension is treated as a new reservation. If you leave before your confirmed departure date without receiving an official cancellation confirmation, the original booking terms will remain in effect.
content.bookingTransferability: Your booking must stay under your name for the entire stay. Transferring the reservation or changing the guest name is not allowed. If someone attempts to check in under a transferred booking, the reservation will be canceled immediately, and you will remain financially responsible for the full amount.
content.prepaidNonRefundableBookings: Pre-paid, Non-Refundable reservations require full payment at the time of booking. If the payment does not go through, your reservation will be canceled automatically. These bookings are not refundable, even if you cancel or do not show up. Any extension to your stay will be processed as a separate, new non-refundable booking.

meta.title: Complete Check-in & Checkout Guide for Hostel Brikette Positano
meta.description: Step-by-step instructions on arrival times, ID requirements, luggage storage, deposits, and checkout support at Hostel Brikette in Positano.

content.checkInRequest: When you arrive, please visit our reception desk to start your check-in process and receive your room assignment.
content.earlyArrival: If you arrive before 10:30 AM on your booking date, please note that you will not yet be able to enter the hostel.
content.middayArrival: If you arrive between 10:30 AM and 3:00 PM, you may be allowed entry as a Temporary Guest, pending approval. During this time, you may request luggage storage, provided space is available. Please note luggage storage is separate from your room booking and has its own terms and conditions.
content.checkInWindow: You can check in from 3:00 PM to 10:30 PM daily. During this time, you'll follow our standard check-in process.
content.lateArrival: If you plan to arrive after our reception closes at 10:30 PM, we may offer you a self-service late check-in option, subject to availability. We will send instructions to the contact details you provided during booking. Make sure your device is charged and your details are correct, as we cannot be responsible for issues caused by incorrect information or technical failures.
content.necessityOfProcess: You must complete the full check-in procedure to enter the hostel. If you cannot complete check-in, your reservation will be canceled and treated as a No Show.
content.proofOfIdentity: You must present a valid original form of identification (passport, national ID card, driver's license, or military ID) upon arrival. If you do not provide valid ID by 10:30 PM on your scheduled check-in day, your reservation will be canceled as a No Show.
content.paymentBalance: You must fully settle any outstanding balance using an Accepted Payment Method before completing check-in. If you cannot make the full payment, your reservation will be canceled and marked as a No Show.
content.keycardLinenDeposit: At check-in, you'll need to provide a €10 cash deposit for your keycard and linen set. This deposit will be fully refunded in cash upon checkout once you return both items. Credit or debit cards cannot be accepted for this deposit.
content.checkoutWindow: Checkout is from 7:30 AM to 10:30 AM. After checkout, you cannot re-enter your room or leave any personal belongings behind.
content.earlyCheckout: If you need to depart before 7:30 AM, please arrange early checkout at reception the evening before to receive your deposit refund in cash. Leaving your keycard without staff confirmation will result in forfeiture of the deposit.
content.lateCheckout: We cannot provide late checkout. Checkout should be complete by 10:30am.
content.failureToCheckout: If you don't vacate your room by the official checkout time, we may remove your belongings without liability. Your items could be stored with a local porter service at your expense. Any unauthorized entry afterward will be treated as a security breach.
content.postCheckout: Once you checkout, your reservation officially ends. You may remain on the hostel premises as a Temporary Guest until 3:30 PM. You can request luggage storage, subject to availability and separate conditions.

meta.title: Defects and Damages Guide for Positano Hostel
meta.description: Understand how to report room defects, our response to serious issues, damage deposit policies, guest liability, and essential information on bed-bug prevention at Positano's exclusive hostel.

content.reportingDefects: If you notice any issue or defect in your room, please inform us immediately. Your prompt notification helps us quickly address and resolve the problem.
content.assessingDefects: Once you report a defect, we'll assess the issue promptly and prioritize our response based on how significantly it impacts your comfort and stay.
content.responseToSeriousDefects: If there's a serious defect that cannot be immediately repaired, we'll provide alternative accommodation. If the alternative is cheaper than your booked room, we'll refund you the price difference. If you decide not to accept our alternative, you can request a pro-rata refund for the remaining nights of your stay.
content.unreportedDefects: If we discover an issue in your room that you haven't reported within a reasonable timeframe, we will evaluate any resulting damages, and our damage policy may be applied.
content.damagesPolicy: For your security and ours, we may pre-authorize your credit card or request a cash deposit at check-in to cover potential damages or losses. If you cannot provide a deposit or pre-authorization, your reservation may be canceled. Deposits are fully refundable at checkout, minus charges for any damages, losses, labour, or administrative expenses incurred. If these charges exceed your deposit, you will be responsible for the additional costs. Labour rates for repairs or cleanup are billed hourly: Director (€50/hour), Manager (€35/hour), and Staff (€25/hour).
content.bedBugsPolicy: We proactively manage and promptly address any bed-bug issues. However, if bed bugs are found in your room during your stay, you may be held responsible for associated costs, such as lost booking revenue, cleaning expenses, and pest control. Please immediately report any bed-bug signs to our staff.
content.bedBugsPrevention:
To help prevent bed-bug issues, please:
• Inform us at check-in if you've recently stayed somewhere with known bed-bug problems.
• Thoroughly disinfect your belongings.
• Carefully inspect your luggage and clothing for bed bugs before entering your room.

content.submittingBookingRequest: Send us your booking request through an authorised Online Travel Agent (OTA) or directly on our website — chats or walk-ins alone don't count. By clicking 'Book', you confirm that all names, dates, and stay length are correct and that you accept our Terms & Conditions.
content.processingBookingRequest: We start processing your request as soon as we successfully receive any required deposit, pre-authorisation, or payment using one of our accepted payment methods. Make sure the booking shows the name of the credit-card holder who will pay. If the payer's name is different, email us a short authorisation from the cardholder before we process your request.
content.decliningBookingRequest: We rarely decline a booking, but we reserve the right to do so at our discretion — for example, if payment fails, required information is missing, or the request breaches our Terms & Conditions.
content.requestSizeLimit: One booking request can cover up to seven (7) consecutive nights and a maximum of five (5) guests. Need a longer stay or a bigger group? Simply split it into separate requests.
content.counterOffer: If your preferred room is already taken, we'll email you a counter-offer with the closest alternative. Accept the offer and complete the payment or pre-authorisation to lock in your stay.
content.prepaidNonRefundableBookingsPolicy: Choosing a Pre-paid Non-Refundable rate saves you money but requires full payment upfront. We'll try your card up to three times. If all attempts fail, we'll cancel the request. These bookings cannot be refunded or modified.
content.confirmationEmail: Once your payment clears, we'll send a confirmation email to the address you gave us. It lists your booking reference, arrival date, length of stay, and any extras. Read it carefully and tell us immediately if anything looks wrong.
content.numberOfGuestsIncluded:
Your booking automatically covers the following:
• 1 guest per single bed
• Up to 2 guests per double bed
• Up to the advertised capacity of any apartment you book
For safety and comfort we can't accommodate extra guests above the room's limit.
content.scopeOfFacilitiesIncluded:
Every guest receives:
• Fresh linen and a keycard
• Use of the shared showers
• Hot water during scheduled hours (about 07:00-10:30 and 17:00-22:30)
• Access to our communal areas
Other perks (breakfast, Wi-Fi, luggage storage, etc.) are complimentary and follow their own simple rules.
content.financialObligation: The credit-card holder named on your booking is liable for all charges — room fees, damages, cleaning fees, fines, or penalties for breaking house rules. Unpaid amounts may be charged directly to the card on file.
content.roomAllocation: We guarantee you the bed type and room category you booked. Dorm bookings secure a bed in the chosen category, but we can't promise that groups will share the same room. Beds in dorms are chosen first-come, first-served when you check in.
content.allocatingUpgrades: Sometimes we upgrade you to a better room free of charge, or you can pay to upgrade when you book. If the free upgrade later becomes impractical, we may move you back to the category you originally paid for.
content.thirdPartyPayments: When you book through an OTA, you'll pay through their system under their terms. We never see your card details from the OTA and aren't liable for issues on their platform. Always check that your payment went through and that you received a confirmation.
content.bookingRequestDeposits: Some rates need a deposit to hold the room. Pre-paid rates require 100% up-front. Deposits are non-refundable. If we can't take the deposit, the booking request is automatically cancelled.
content.bookingRequestPreauthorisations: For flexible rates we may pre-authorise your card for the first night or the full stay to guarantee your booking. If the pre-authorisation fails, we'll decline the request.
content.safeguardingProcess: When you check in, we may place a security hold equal to one night per guest to cover possible fines, fees, extensions, or damages. If a card hold isn't possible, you can leave the same amount in cash or use another guest's card. If neither option works, we unfortunately have to cancel your booking.

content.alcoholPolicy: Because we are a licensed venue, you may not bring or consume alcohol bought off-site anywhere on hostel property. If you arrive with outside alcohol, our team will store it safely and return it at checkout (or once you confirm it will be consumed off-site). Our team's decision on this is final. Bringing or drinking outside alcohol will cancel your booking on the spot, be treated as a No-Show, and no refund will be issued.
content.dutyOfCare:
While you are with us, you share the hostel with other guests, staff, and contractors. Please:
• Respect everyone's privacy and personal space.
• Take care not to damage hostel or guest property.
• Keep noise to a reasonable level and help maintain a calm, friendly atmosphere.
• Follow any additional rules or instructions given by our staff.
If you ignore these duties, we may cancel your booking immediately (recorded as a No-Show), ask you to leave without refund, and hold you financially responsible for fines, legal costs, reputational damage, or any other expense. Any illegal activity will be reported straight away to local authorities.

content.modificationOfTerms: These Terms and Conditions make up the entire agreement between you and Positano Hostel, replacing any earlier promises or understandings. We may update or modify them at any time, and the new version will apply as soon as it appears online.
content.scopeOfLiability: Our responsibility to you covers only the services and items listed in these Terms. Any compensation is capped at the total amount you have paid for your booking. We are not responsible for indirect or economic losses such as profit, goodwill, or missed opportunities—even if caused by negligence or unforeseen events (force majeure). content.websiteInformation: We do our best to keep our website accurate, but errors can occur and details may change without notice. Photos show the general style of our facilities and may not reflect exact layouts or features. External links are offered for convenience; we accept no responsibility for their content. Please read our privacy policy to learn how we handle your data.
content.healthAndSafetyPolicy: For everyone's safety, please tell us if you've recently been exposed to any contagious illness, including flu or similar viruses. Pre-paid, non-refundable reservations remain non-refundable in these cases, so we strongly recommend travel insurance to cover health-related disruptions to your plans.

meta.title: Safety & Security Guidelines – Positano Hostel
meta.description: All the key information on how we keep every guest—and their belongings—safe at Positano Hostel, including lockers, wristbands, CCTV, and visitor guidelines.

content.personalBelongingsSecurity: Each guest is responsible for their personal belongings throughout their stay. Lockers and safe boxes are provided where available; using them is simple but does not shift liability to the hostel, so we recommend keeping your travel-insurance up to date. For everyone’s peace of mind, keep room doors shut and secure the locker provided—items. Items left behind for more than 30 days will be donated, recycled, or disposed of.
content.identificationSecurityBands: To help staff quickly recognise registered guests, everyone receives a security wristband at check-in. Please wear it while on hostel premises; our team may also ask to see photo ID. If your band is lost or damaged, let reception know—there is a small replacement fee. Guests who are not wearing a wristband or who decline to show ID may be asked to leave, and refunds may not be possible.
content.cctvSurveillance: Shared areas—including the entrance, hallways, terrace, and common rooms—are monitored by CCTV 24 hours a day. Recordings are stored securely, accessed only by authorised staff. The cameras support guest safety but cannot guarantee against loss, theft, or damage, so please stay alert and secure your valuables.
content.temporaryGuestsPolicy: Please speak with reception before inviting friends to visit, so we can issue them Temporary Guest status. Once signed in with valid ID, day visitors may enjoy communal spaces between 10:30 and 20:00. For everyone’s privacy, guest rooms remain for registered overnight guests only. The hostel may refuse or withdraw Temporary Guest status at its discretion.
content.unregisteredPersonsPolicy: Italian law requires that every overnight guest be registered. If an unregistered person is found staying in a room, the registered guest(s) will be charged the standard room rate for that person plus an administrative fee equal to twice that amount. The additional guest must complete check-in immediately or depart; if they decline, the hostel is obliged to contact the local authorities. Not declaring an overnight guest may also result in the booking being recorded as a No-Show.

intros.ferry: Ferries are the scenic way to move between coastal towns in season. Use these guides to understand when ferries run, how to read operator timetables, and what to do if the sea turns rough. We link to official sources, suggest smart boarding times, and show how to pair a single ferry leg with buses to balance comfort and cost.
intros.bus: The SITA buses are the backbone of car‑free travel along the Amalfi Coast. This tag covers tickets, validation, peak‑time etiquette, and the stops that minimise stair‑climbs in Positano. We also explain how to combine buses with ferries for faster or more scenic itineraries without overspending.
intros.budgeting: Yes, you can experience the Amalfi Coast on a sane budget. Start with our cost breakdowns and money‑saving checklists, then pick itinerary ideas that prioritise free viewpoints, public beach sections, and smart use of passes. We’ll highlight where to splurge for maximum joy — and where to save without missing out.
intros.free: Free and low‑cost doesn’t mean dull. This tag collects our favourite viewpoints, public beach areas, town walks, and DIY experiences you can string together for memorable days — all while keeping your costs in check.
intros.itinerary: Short on time or planning a longer trip? Our itineraries help you sequence days logically, avoid backtracking, and catch the best light at the most photogenic spots. Expect clear day‑by‑day suggestions and alternatives for weather or energy changes.
intros.amalfi: Amalfi Town anchors the ferry network and connects easily to Ravello by bus. Use these guides to plan day trips, understand pier logistics, and decide when a ferry is worth it over the bus for comfort and views.
intros.ravello: Ravello sits high above Amalfi with celebrated gardens and summer concerts. We explain how to get there, what to expect at events, and how to time returns when evening schedules thin out.
intros.capri: Capri rewards early starts: arrive on the first ferries, loop Anacapri and Marina Piccola, and be back before the last‑sailing rush. Our guides highlight cost‑savvy choices and crowd‑dodging routes.
intros.photography: Positano is photogenic — and busy. These articles show you when and where to shoot the classics without queues, plus underrated alternatives and etiquette so everyone gets the shot safely.
intros.viewpoints: From terrace bends on Via Pasitea to clifftop trails, these are the angles that define the Amalfi Coast. Learn how to reach them, when the light is best, and how to avoid blocking narrow paths.
intros.hiking: Trails like the Path of the Gods offer world‑class views. Get there via bus, know your options for shorter or knee‑friendly routes, and pack appropriately for heat or sudden changes in weather.
intros.stairs: Stairs are part of Positano life. Our logistics pieces minimise needless climbs and show which bus stops and micro‑routes keep luggage‑hauling to a minimum.
intros.porters: When bags are heavy or you’re arriving by ferry, porters can be a smart choice. These guides explain when to use them, typical workflows, and alternatives late at night or in rough weather.
intros.connectivity: Wi‑Fi, eSIMs, and sockets: remote‑work‑friendly information grounded in reality. We include typical speeds, backup options, and etiquette for working in cafés.
intros.digital-nomads: Balancing work and travel in Positano is doable with planning. Expect tips on routines, quiet corners, and seasonality so you can meet your deadlines and still catch golden hour.
intros.cuisine: From limoncello to simple seafood pastas and lemon‑forward desserts, learn what to try and how to order confidently. We favour small, honest experiences and smart ways to taste widely without overspending.
intros.event: Seasonal celebrations and concerts add magic to the coast. These guides focus on how to attend smoothly: tickets, dress codes, getting there and back, and where to stand for great views.
intros.seasonal: Crowds and schedules change with the seasons. We explain what’s open, how transport shifts, and how to adapt your plans for shoulder or winter months while keeping the experience great.
intros.no-car: You don’t need a car here. Combine ferries for seaside hops and buses for ridge towns; our itineraries show practical sequences that keep transfers efficient and scenic.
intros.passes: When day passes beat singles — and when they don’t. We compare options, show validation rules, and help you avoid fines while saving money on busy days of bus travel.
intros.decision: Fork‑in‑the‑road choices like Naples vs Salerno arrivals can change your day. Our decision guides lay out the trade‑offs by season, timing, luggage, and budget so you can choose fast.
intros.train: High‑speed to Naples or Salerno, regional to Sorrento — then buses or ferries onward. These pieces demystify reservations, supplements, and last‑mile steps to Positano.
intros.off-season: Quieter months reward planners. Expect variable weather, fewer ferries, and cosy routines — our guides cover connectivity, groceries, and day‑trip ideas that still shine.
intros.winter: Winter can be special: cool air, open views, and calmer streets. We outline what stays open, how transport changes, and how to pack for comfort on stairs and trails.
intros.camping: Camping near the Amalfi Coast requires forethought. We point to designated sites, access considerations, and the etiquette and safety basics for a good experience.
intros.cost: Understand typical spend ranges and the levers that move your budget up or down. We surface simple swaps that keep the experience rich while keeping costs in check.
intros.tips: Tactical advice that saves time and stress — from timing ferries to choosing the right bus stop. These are small changes that add up to smoother days.
intros.work-life: Make room for both focus and fun. Build routines around quiet hours, reliable Wi‑Fi pockets, and sunset windows so you enjoy the best of both worlds.
intros.souvenirs: Bring home tasteful, packable reminders: ceramics, prints, and small pantry goods. We share where to find fair prices and how to pack or ship items safely.
intros.comparison: Choosing a base? Compare Positano’s views, Sorrento’s connections, and Amalfi’s balance to match your style and budget.
intros.insurance: A quick primer on coverage for health, cancellations, electronics, hiking, and ferries. Keep essential documents handy so any claim is simple to file.
intros.hitchhiking: Roads here are narrow with few safe pull‑offs. Hitchhiking isn’t advisable; we explain safer, reliable alternatives that still keep costs low.
intros.walking-tour: Stair lanes and terrace views make for great DIY walks. Follow our loops to balance views with realistic times and effort.
intros.audio-guide: Download before you go or use Wi‑Fi hotspots along the route. Keep volume low and be mindful of other walkers on busy paths.
intros.work-exchange: Thinking about volunteering in a hostel? Understand roles, hours, and legal basics in Italy before you commit — and how to evaluate opportunities responsibly.
intros.wellness: Stay active with stair loops, beach runs, and hikes. Pack good footwear, stay hydrated, and plan sessions for cooler parts of the day.
intros.couples: Couples can thrive in hostels with the right expectations. Choose privates or strategic bunks, carry earplugs, and plan early activities for calmer streets.
intros.accommodation: Pick the right base for your style and budget. We explain areas, trade‑offs, and how to minimise stairs on arrival and departure.
intros.hostel-life: Hostels are social and great value. Learn what to expect at Brikette — from terraces and the bar to practical tips for shared spaces.
intros.logistics: Small logistics make a big difference: tickets, bus stops, luggage, and simple micro‑routes that save time and effort on stairs.
intros.travel-tips: Practical pointers gathered from first‑hand experience — what to bring, how to pack light, and when to adjust plans for weather or crowds.
intros.experiences: Boat tours, beach days, hikes, and viewpoints — these guides help you choose experiences that fit your time, budget, and energy.
intros.boat: Private or group tours along the coast are a highlight in calm weather. We cover expectations, seasonality, and alternatives when seas are rough.
intros.rome: Getting here from Rome is straightforward with high‑speed trains and a simple last‑mile. We compare options and show how to keep the trip smooth.
intros.car: Driving the coast is beautiful but demanding. Learn about ZTLs, parking realities, and the alternated‑plate rules in high season before committing.
intros.wineries: Small family wineries in Tramonti and the hills produce DOC wines with character. Book tastings in advance, go with a designated driver or a tour, and pick bottles that travel well.
intros.tramonti: Tramonti’s terraced vineyards are a quiet contrast to the seaside bustle. Expect scenic roads, small producers, and limited public transport — plan ahead.
intros.scooter: Scooters are agile but risky on the SS163’s blind corners. Rent only if experienced, carry proper documents, and consider Sorrento for better availability and rates.
intros.pets: Traveling with pets is doable with planning. Check policies in advance, carry carriers for buses/ferries, and avoid hot pavements at midday.
intros.shopping: Support local artisans: made‑to‑measure sandals, ceramics, and prints. Ask about materials, provenance, and safe shipping options for fragile items.
intros.stories: Local legends — from mermaids to saints — add color to places you’ll visit. Treat them as cultural clues that enrich festivals and landmarks.
intros.history: A compact history of Positano and the Amalfi Coast helps you see more in each walk: trade routes, religion, and modern tourism intertwine here.
intros.language: A handful of Italian phrases makes travel smoother. Learn basics for buses, ferries, cafés, and polite interactions.
intros.gateway: Town and transport hubs like Sorrento, Salerno, and Naples act as gateways to the coast. Use them for smarter arrivals and cheaper connections.
